page.title: 10SEVERN STOKE ENVIRONMENT
page.content: The Ecology of Severn Stoke is closely interwoven with the regime of the {River Severn.}There have been many floods this century, the most severe of which was in 1947, when the water level was over the counter of the Rose & Crown pub (4' above ground level)! St. Deny's church is one of the few churches in England liable to flooding, although it is on slightly higher ground and is usually unaffected. The{soil structure}of the area is a loam of gravel and clay with keuper, with a sub_soil of marl and alluvium. There is a long footpath beside the river and another leading up to Severn Bank House. There is no real source of {pollution}in the area, except when the traffic on the M5 is at a standstill.
